purpose.summary: This file defines an IMS Program Specification Block (PSB) named PAUTBUNL for a COBOL language program. It specifies a single PCB named PAUTBPCB providing access to the IMS database DBDNAME=DBPAUTP0 with PROCOPT=GOTP and KEYLEN=14. The PCB defines two sensegments: PAUTSUM0 as the root segment (PARENT=0) and PAUTDTL1 as a child segment under PAUTSUM0.

inputs.name: DBPAUTP0
inputs.description: IMS database referenced by the PCB, accessible via segments PAUTSUM0 (root) and PAUTDTL1 (child)

open_questions.question: What is the business purpose of the DBPAUTP0 database and its segments PAUTSUM0/PAUTDTL1?
open_questions.context: No descriptive comments or names indicate business meaning beyond technical IMS structure
open_questions.suggestion: Review associated DBD definitions or calling COBOL programs for context

open_questions.question: Is this PSB used in batch DL/I, MPP, BMP, or IFP region?
open_questions.context: PROCOPT=GOTP suggests possible TP usage, but no explicit region type specified
open_questions.suggestion: Check JCL or IMS region definitions for the PAUTBUNL program
